div.p: Hey Huskies, show us your best Husky Nation stay at home poster. We'll be awarding prizes to individuals in different age divisions and to winning classes. Make sure to publish your photo before May 1st !

As we examine options for the end of the year that ensure the safety of all of our children, their families and our staff in light of this pandemic, we would appreciate your input. Starting May 7, the school will have multiple options for instructional delivery through the end of the year: continued distance learning, limited reentry, and a blended model. Please email us at beltfamilyconnection@beltschool.com and let us know your thoughts or comments. Thank you

At noon today (4/22) the Governor announced that schools in MT may re-open if they choose on May 7th. We are exploring the option of reopening the school and the guidelines the state provided to assist schools in making that decision.

4th Q Mid-Term Progress Reports will be mailed out next week. If you want real-time updates on grades and/or student progress contact the school and we can walk you through getting the free PowerSchool Mobile app for your personal device.

It was good to visit with our Seniors today about some of the plans we are working on for Graduation. Parents, contact Mrs. Gliko to obtain the notes from our discussion or if you have questions. We should have a more formal plan for Graduation to share in the next couple weeks.
